page.title: 05TYPICAL DAY OF A MINER.
page.content: Most of the miners work at{Silverwood {Colliery}and go there by car. Usually miners work{shifts}which are days, afternoons and nights. All workers wear{protective clothes,}which are boots, helmet, overalls and knee_pads. The miners take a packed lunch for their dinner, which they have to eat down the pit near their machines. Many miners spend their{leisure}time fishing and at local pubs, and some of their hobbies are gardening and watching sport. Miners get up{early}in the morning about five a.m. to have a cup of tea. Most of the{grandfathers and{fathers}used to work there before them. They usually work{eight hours}a day and many of them have worked there for over{twenty years.}Some of the miners attend{clubs}in their spare time such as cricket, golf, and football, but many{work weekends.}
